content: instruction stitches 1 **start using contrasting color** 6 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 2 *2 single_crochet in each single_crochet* around 12 3 *single_crochet in next 1 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 18 **change back to main color at end of this row ** 4 work even single_crochet in each single_crochet around 18 5 work even 18 6 *single_crochet in next 1 single_crochet decrease over next 2 single_crochet* around 12 7 *single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet decrease over next 2 single_crochet* around 9 8 work even stuff foot / paw at this point stuff firmly 9 9 - work even slip_stitch to join and bind off leaving an 8 long tail to 9 17 sew the leg to the body later on do not stuff the rest of the leg page 4 of single_crochet work 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet 12 single_crochet in next 4 single_crochet 4 *decrease over next 2 stitches* around slip_stitch to join and bind off 6 leaving an 8 long tail so you can sew the ears to the head later on **do not stuff the ears they will lay flat tail consider using contrasting color for the tail row instruction stitches 1 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 6 2 *single_crochet in next 1 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 9 3 *single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 12 4 *decrease over next 2 stitches* around slip_stitch to join and bind off 6 leaving an 8 long tail so you can sew the tail to the body later on stuff the tail firmly page 5 of 10 copyright back since you have 18 stitches at the bottom of the head and the top of the body you should have no problem sewing them together page 6 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry from the center bottom beginning row i do the arms first so i can see where the middle of the body is going to be then start stitching the leg from the center of the body towards the hip page 7 of 10
